summary: 1.6 million people died of tuberculosis in 2017, higher than their share of estimated cases. 1.7 billion people, 23% of the world's population, are estimated to have a latent TB infection. influenza viruses cause mild to moderate respiratory illness in most people, but some develop fatal infections. virulence factors encoded by viral genes can explain seasonal or geographical differences at a population level. TB outcome depends on host intrinsic (genetics) and extrinsic factors, as well as on host factors that are still unclear. -like receptors (TLR), nucleotide-binding oligomerization domain-containing
